Sequence Information.Peptide Name: BmKn-22 (BmKn2 analog, synthetic AMPs, XXA, UCLL1c)
Sequence Information.Source: C-terminal amino acid truncation, animal-derived, natural derivative

Literature Information.Literature:
Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is similar (84.62%) toparent peptide BmKn2I=L=A: 18%.Activity: inhibited biofilm formation of P. aeruginosa weakly. Dose-dependent (200-800 uM) inhibited biofilm formation and disrupted biofilms.Antivirulence:bacteria:P. aeruginosa:  Also exerted inhibitory activity against pyocyanin production.Structure: predicted to be helical.In vitro toxicity: sheep RBC: not hemo.lytic. Low toxicity to L929 cells. 
Updated 10/2024
Literature Information.Author: Teerapo K, Roytrakul S, Sistayanarain A, Kunthalert D. 2019
Literature Information.Title: A scorpion venom peptide derivative BmKn-22 with potent antibiofilm activity against Pseudomonas aeruginosa.
